text: The new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra has finally landed, giving us Samsung’s take on a flagship smartphone for 2025. It has all the typical improvements you’d expect out of an upgrade like this, including a large 6.9-inch display, Qualcomm’s new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, and a list of AI features so long that it would take a thousand words just to name them all. But when it comes to its cameras, there’s really only one improvement – the new 50MP ultra-wide sensor which also doubles as the macro camera. Samsung’s Ultra-lineup has needed an ultra-wide sensor upgrade for years and it looks like this one kits the spot. Save up to $1,200 on the Galaxy S25 Ultra Unfortunately, Samsung hasn’t given us any upgrades for the other sensors on the phone, but we do finally get LOG video capture (up to 120fps on the main and ultra-wide cameras). For content creators who rely on their smartphones to record video, this is quite significant. For those of you curious as to how the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra‘s cameras fare when compared to the iPhone 16 Pro, we’ve put together a detailed camera comparison that shows more than 100 side-by-side photos and videos from the two devices in different lighting conditions. Take a look at the video and image gallery below and let us know what camera you like best. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra camera specifications 200 MP, f/1.7, 24mm (wide), 1/1.3″, 0.6µm, multi-directional PDAF, OIS 10 MP, f/2.4, 67mm (telephoto), 1/3.52″, 1.12µm, PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom 50 MP, f/3.4, 111mm (periscope telephoto), 1/2.52″, 0.7µm, PDAF, OIS, 5x optical zoom 50 MP, f/1.9, 120˚ (ultrawide), 0.7µm, dual pixel PDAF, Super Steady video Selfie: 12 MP, f/2.2, 26mm (wide), 1/3.2″, 1.12µm, dual pixel PDAF Video: 8K@24/30fps, 4K@30/60/120fps, 1080p@30/60/240fps, 10-bit HDR, HDR10+, stereo sound rec., gyro-EIS Apple iPhone 16 Pro camera specifications 48 MP, f/1.8, 24mm (wide), 1/1.28″, 1.22µm, dual pixel PDAF, sensor-shift OIS 12 MP, f/2.8, 120mm (periscope telephoto), 1/3.06″, 1.12µm, dual pixel PDAF, 3D sensor‑shift OIS, 5x optical zoom 48 MP, f/2.2, 13mm (ultrawide), 0.7µm, PDAF TOF 3D LiDAR scanner (depth) Selfie: 12 MP, f/1.9, 23mm (wide), 1/3.6″, PDAF, OIS Video: 4K@24/25/30/60/100/120fps Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra versus iPhone 16 Pro camera samples I'm a life-long tech enthusiast who has a soft spot for HTC. After writing about tech for more than a decade, I jumped at the opportunity to take on the role of Editor in Chief at Phandroid. Please contact me at [email protected]. html:
The new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra has finally landed, giving us Samsung’s take on a flagship smartphone for 2025. It has all the typical improvements you’d expect out of an upgrade like this, including a large 6.9-inch display, Qualcomm’s new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, and a list of AI features so long that it would take a thousand words just to name them all. But when it comes to its cameras, there’s really only one improvement – the new 50MP ultra-wide sensor which also doubles as the macro camera. Samsung’s Ultra-lineup has needed an ultra-wide sensor upgrade for years and it looks like this one kits the spot.

Save up to $1,200 on the Galaxy S25 Ultra

Unfortunately, Samsung hasn’t given us any upgrades for the other sensors on the phone, but we do finally get LOG video capture (up to 120fps on the main and ultra-wide cameras). For content creators who rely on their smartphones to record video, this is quite significant.

For those of you curious as to how the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra‘s cameras fare when compared to the iPhone 16 Pro, we’ve put together a detailed camera comparison that shows more than 100 side-by-side photos and videos from the two devices in different lighting conditions. Take a look at the video and image gallery below and let us know what camera you like best.

Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra camera specifications

  • 200 MP, f/1.7, 24mm (wide), 1/1.3″, 0.6µm, multi-directional PDAF, OIS
  • 10 MP, f/2.4, 67mm (telephoto), 1/3.52″, 1.12µm, PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom
  • 50 MP, f/3.4, 111mm (periscope telephoto), 1/2.52″, 0.7µm, PDAF, OIS,
  • 5x optical zoom
  • 50 MP, f/1.9, 120˚ (ultrawide), 0.7µm, dual pixel PDAF, Super Steady video
  • Selfie: 12 MP, f/2.2, 26mm (wide), 1/3.2″, 1.12µm, dual pixel PDAF
  • Video: 8K@24/30fps, 4K@30/60/120fps, 1080p@30/60/240fps, 10-bit HDR, HDR10+, stereo sound rec., gyro-EIS

Apple iPhone 16 Pro camera specifications

  • 48 MP, f/1.8, 24mm (wide), 1/1.28″, 1.22µm, dual pixel PDAF, sensor-shift OIS
  • 12 MP, f/2.8, 120mm (periscope telephoto), 1/3.06″, 1.12µm, dual pixel PDAF, 3D sensor‑shift OIS, 5x optical zoom
  • 48 MP, f/2.2, 13mm (ultrawide), 0.7µm, PDAF
  • TOF 3D LiDAR scanner (depth)
  • Selfie: 12 MP, f/1.9, 23mm (wide), 1/3.6″, PDAF, OIS
  • Video: 4K@24/25/30/60/100/120fps

Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra versus iPhone 16 Pro camera samples

I'm a life-long tech enthusiast who has a soft spot for HTC. After writing about tech for more than a decade, I jumped at the opportunity to take on the role of Editor in Chief at Phandroid. Please contact me at [email protected].
